content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

New themes from Jamie Mitchell and Zig Zag Press; a new WordPress cookbook plugin from Shay Bocks and WP Site Care; and StudioPress chats with Chris Lema.

Themes

Jamie Mitchell launches a new premium theme, Local Business Pro.

Just one example of how my Local Business Pro theme can be customised for your business. https://t.co/WsJs5mmD2X #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/n6eHDhOlqv

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) October 29, 2016

ZigZagPress launch their 32nd (yes that’s a 3 and a 2 together) Genesis child theme, Tahini, aimed at foodies (who’d have thought it?).

Introducing Tahini: an elegant #genesiswp theme for foodies, bloggers and storytellers & our 32nd child theme!https://t.co/1avUwgfLmC

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) October 25, 2016

Andrei Chira revamps his (free) Genesis child theme, KIMI.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, KIMI, a free Genesis child theme by @andreichira7 https://t.co/uSWyHUYoV6 pic.twitter.com/45GRtwykkA

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) October 26, 2016

Showcase

Tara Claeys and Evelyn Powers with a new Genesis and Beaver Builder powered site for avports.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, new Genesis / Beaver Builder site from @design_tlc & @DesignPowers https://t.co/qPUxCDyDXQ pic.twitter.com/NoiBcIv5xA

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) October 28, 2016

Carrie Dils did a sneaky under the radar relaunch of her site and didn’t tell you! But you’ll forgive her instantly when your eyes gaze on the awesomeness that is the new carriedils.com (h/t Susanta Sahoo)

@sushantsahoo @GenesisWPguide There was no announcement. I was quiet about it to make sure I had the kinks ironed out. 🙂

— carrie dils (@cdils) October 28, 2016

Jo Waltham launches a new site, based on the Sunshine Pro theme, for bespokewigsbyourmommys.co.uk

Thrilled to share the launch of our client's site Bespoke Wigs
https://t.co/GHquOqgPGW @JMiddlet0nPhoto @unramble Sunshine Pro #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/czmY31DoA9

— Callia Web (@CalliaWeb) October 26, 2016

Krista DeLisle for skagitbookkeepingservices.com

My Latest Work ? Skagit Bookkeeping :: Logo + Website https://t.co/LFbIEXZwwU #webdesign #branding #logo #bookkeeper #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/czfgMd2j9D

— Krista DeLisle (@colorandcode_) October 26, 2016

Matt Whiteley with a new Genesis site (and a new WordPress service business) at creativepixelsmedia.com

Proud to be 100% up and running smoothly with our Managed WP Hosting site – https://t.co/vxonWhqIS5. Check it out! #genesiswp using @eddwp

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) October 30, 2016

And Thauna updates her portfolio (plus adds a fancy filter)

I've updated my portfolio & now you can filter by project & client type (using #facetwp) #genesiswp https://t.co/3buBUqDR6l

— Thauna (@BellanoStudio) October 23, 2016

Podcasts

StudioPress.fm speaks to Chris Lema on how to be a great community leader and leveraging WordPress in your business.

How to Be a Great Community Leader, with @chrislema — https://t.co/VnMofTSX4P pic.twitter.com/hOwxwjssyk

— StudioPress (@studiopress) October 26, 2016

And when Carrie’s not relaunching her site (see Showcase above) she’s kicking off the new season of OfficeHours.fm live and direct to you on 3 November at 8pm EST. Be there or be very square.

True story: the podcast is BACK on November 3rd, 8pET. Mark your calendars. 🙂

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) October 24, 2016

Best of the rest

Shay Bocks, who many of you will know for her successful foodie Genesis child themes, launches a new cookbook plugin in collaboration with the folk over at WP Site Care this week.

I’ve not used the plugin yet, but it’s clear a lot of thought has gone into it and I’d expect nothing but quality from the people behind it, so definitely one to check out if food sites are your thing.

Cook more. Tech less. Recipe plugin webinar today! Join us to explore this thing! https://t.co/89pILINOXj #foodblogger #WordPress #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/MZKMOBN8qe

— Shay Bocks (@feastdesignco) October 26, 2016

Sridhar Katakam with a tutorial on creating a Horizontal Opt-in Form in Genesis using eNews Extended plugin and Flexbox

Horizontal Opt-in Form in Genesis using eNews Extended plugin and Flexbox: https://t.co/IKTGo5D9SC#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/qBY05tsr36

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 26, 2016

Susanta Sahoo on conditionally displaying categories in the primary menu with Genesis.

Display Categories in Primary Menu Conditionally in #GenesisWP https://t.co/TROnrbyfnY

— League WP (@league_wp) October 26, 2016

Not content with launching a new theme, Jamie Mitchell also shares new tutorials on creating a WooCommerce cart icon (with count) in Genesis…

How to add a Woocommerce cart icon to your Genesis theme to increase customer purchases. https://t.co/pCxeMSGGce #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/CEpLLLzfM1

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) October 25, 2016

…and how to create a masonry layout in Genesis (plus a free sample theme to show you how it’s done!)

Ever wanted to create a pinterest-like masonry layout in Genesis? This tutorial will show you how https://t.co/74MWOjDcA8 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/cuEuaQC0rB

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) October 24, 2016

Omar Al-Ansari on how to create a timeline in Genesis using Advanced Custom Fields Pro.

Create a Timeline in Genesis using ACF Pro • alansari.io https://t.co/2ONGi69PyG#GenesisWP #WordPress

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) October 28, 2016

Marius Vetrici on how to categorise WordPress comments in Genesis.

How to categorize #WordPress Comments in Genesis Framework #genesiswp @studiopresshttps://t.co/g1mhUfjf6F

— Marius Vetrici (@mariusvetrici) October 27, 2016

 And finally…

Calvin Koepke, creator of many fine (and free) child themes for Genesis, with a tease for you all…

Excited for a new project I'm going to be starting with #genesiswp. Can't tell you yet, but soon…

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) October 26, 2016

—

That’s all for this edition. My thanks, as always though, goes to everyone in this community for creating such great stuff.

I’ll be back next week with more Genesis goodness. Till then, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS If you enjoy these weekly updates, you can also get Genesis news throughout the week by following us on Twitter @GenesisWPguide

excerpt.rendered: New themes from Jamie Mitchell and Zig Zag Press; a new WordPress cookbook plugin from Shay Bocks and WP Site Care; and StudioPress chats with Chris Lema.
